gurmukhi: kwnH Pryb krXo iqn so mn moh mhwN iqnky ju kroXo ]bwr BXo qq kRoD mno iqh mY jl sIql moh smoXo ]183]
transliteration: Kaahn Pdareb Daryo Tin So Man Moh Mahaan Tinke Ju Daroyo|| Baar Bhayo Tat Krodh Mano Tih Mai Jal Seetal Moh Samoyo||183||
translation: Krishna did not tell them anything and in this way, he increased their feeling of attachment; seeing the form of Krishna, the anger of all cooled down like water.183.

gurmukhi: moih bVXo iqh ky mn mY nih Coif skY Apno suq koaU ]gaUAin Coif skY bCry ieqno mn moh krY qb soaU ]
transliteration: Moh(i) Badyo Tih Ke Man Mai Nah(i) Chhodh(i) Sakai Apno Sout Kooo|| Gadoan(i) Chhodh(i) Sakai Bachhre Itno Man Moh Darai Tah Sooo||
translation: The affection increased in the minds of all, because no one of them could abandon his son; the affection of cows and calves could be forsaken;

gurmukhi: pY grUey giHgy sMig lY iqn cauk hlI ieih bwq lvoaU ]dyv frI mmqw ien pY ik cirqR ikDo hirko ieh hoaU ]184]
transliteration: Pai Darooe Grih-ge San(i) Lai Tin Chaouk Halieh(i) Baat Lavooo|| Dev Darimamtaa In Pai Ki Charitra Kidho Har(i)ko Eh Hooo||184||
translation: In the way, gradually, remembering all these things all went to their homes; seeing all this Yashoda was also frightened and thought that possible this was some miracle of Krishna.184.

gurmukhi: swl ibqIq Bey jbhI hir jI bn bIc gey idn kaunY ]dyKn kauqk ko cqurwnn SIGR BXo iqhko auiT gaunY ]
transliteration: Saal Biteet Bhae Jab-hijiban Beech Gad Din Kaounai Dekhan Kaoutak Ko Chaturaanan Sheeghra Bhayo Tihko Outh(i) Gadddai||
translation: After the lapse of several years, once Krishna went to the forest, Brahma also reached there in order to see his wonderful play;

gurmukhi: gÍwr vhY bCury sMig hY vh c`kRq jwie gieE huie qaunY ]dyiK iqnY fr kY pr pwien AwiekY AwnMd duMdB CaunY ]185]
transliteration: Gvaar Vahai Bachhure San(i) Hai Vah Chakkrat Jaae Gado Hue Taounai|| Dekh(i) Tinai Dar Kai Par Paain Aaekai Aanand Doundabh Chhaounai||185||
translation: He was astonished to see the same gopa children and calves that he had stolen; seeing all this, Brahma fell at the feet of Krishna, in fear and in bliss he began to play musical instruments denting rejoicings.185.
Speech of Brahma addressed to Krishna:

gurmukhi: hy krunwinD hy jg ky piq A`cuq hY ibnqI sun lIjY ]cUk BeI hmqy qumrI iqhqy Aprwp iCmwpn kIjY ]
transliteration: He Karounaanidh He Jag Ke Pat(i) Achchout He Bintisoun Leejai|| Chook Bhaihamte Toumritihte Apraadh Chhimaapan Keejai||
translation: “O Lord of the world! Treasure of Mercy ! Immortal Lord! Listen to my request; I have erred, kindly forgive me for this fault;”

gurmukhi: kwnH khI ieh bwq iCmI hm nw ibK AMmiRq CwifkY pIjY ]ilAwau khXo n ilAwieho jwh isqwb lweIXo nhI FIl krIjY ]186]
transliteration: Kaahn Kahieh Baat Chhimiham Naa Bikh Anmrit Chhaad(i)kai Peejai Liaao Kahyo Na Liaae-ho Jaah Sitaah Aaeeyo Nahidheel Dareeji||186||
translation: Krishna said, “I have forgiven, but abandoning the nectary, the poison should not be taken; go and bring all the men and animals without delay.”186.

gurmukhi: lY bCry bHmw qbhI iCn mY cl kY hirjI pih AwXo ]kwn imly jbhI sB gÍwr qbY mn mY iqnhUM suK pwXo ]
transliteration: Lai Bachhre Brahmaa Tab-hichhin Mai Chal Kai Har(i)jipaih Aayo|| Kaan Mile Jab-hisabh Gvaar Tabai Man Mai Tinhoon Soukh Paayo||
translation: Brahma brought all the calves and gopas in an instant; when all the gopa boys met Krishna, all were greatly pleased;

gurmukhi: lop BXo sMig ky bCry qb Byd iknI lK jwn n pwXo ]bwq buJI n iknI auiT boil su ilAwau vhY hm jo imil KwXo ]187]
transliteration: Lop Bhayo San(i) Ke Bachhre Tab Bhed Kinilakh Jaan Na Paayo|| Baat Bujhina Kiniouth(i) Bol(i) Su Liaao Vahai Ham Jo Mil(i) Khaayo||187||
translation: With this, al the calves made by the maya of Krishna, disappeared, but none could know this mystery; whatever you have brought, we all may eat it together.”187.

gurmukhi: hoie iekqR ikDo biRj bwlk AMin AcXo sBno ju purwno ]kwn khI hm nwg hnXo hir ko ieh Kyl iknI nih jwno ]
transliteration: Hoe Ikatra Kidho Brij Baalak Ann(i) Achyo Sabhno Ju Puraano|| Kaan Kahiham Naag Hanyo Har(i) Ko Eh Khel Kininah(i) Jaano||
translation: The boys of Braja gathered together all the old food and began to eat it; Krishna said, “I have killed the Naga (serpent), but none could know about this play;

gurmukhi: hoie pRsMin mhwN mn mY grVwDuj ko kr r`Ck mwno ]dwn dXo hmko jIA ko ieh mwq ipqw pih jwie bKwno ]188]
transliteration: Hoe Prasann(i) Mahaan Man Mai Gadadaadhuj Ko Kar Rachchhak Maano|| Daan Dayo Hamko Jeea Ko Eh Maat Pitaa Paih Jaae Bakhaano||188||
translation: They were all pleased considering the garuda (blue jay) as their protector; and Krishna said, “You may tell this at your home that Lord has protected our life.”188.
